Articles.Content:
So today the KSP marathon was going on, and they were showing the top five Wacky Landing Challenge images.

And I had done my image last night and sent it in, not expecting much.

So you can guess how surprised I was when I saw this pop-up.

HOW DID THAT HAPPEN!?

Have you never seen a lander that tipped over? Happens all the time, really. Uneven terrain, too much radial velocity at touchdown and other factors often result in 'oops' moment. Sometimes it's posible to recover the situation using landing legs, RCS and rolling. Sometimes it's even possible to take off in such position and reach the orbit.

Have you never seen a lander that tipped over? Happens all the time, really. Uneven terrain, too much radial velocity at touchdown and other factors often result in 'oops' moment. Sometimes it's posible to recover the situation using landing legs, RCS and rolling. Sometimes it's even possible to take off in such position and reach the orbit.

I think the image is his, I could be wrong though

I think the image is his, I could be wrong though

Yeah the image was mine, that's why I was surprised about it.
Congrats! Do you have a full version now?

No, I was one of the runner ups.

Besides, I already have the full version and would have given my friend the copy if I had won.
